SEARCH
Module PSP24
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Board extends Object implements Serializable
Board model class This class represents the game board that contains decks of cards and cards placed on the board.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructor for the Board class. Initializes the board with empty lists for gold cards, resource cards, and objective cards. Also initializes the respective decks for gold cards, resource cards, and objective cards.

  • Method Details

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard()
      Initializes the board by placing cards on it. Sets the common Goals

    • getObjectiveCards

      public ObjectiveCard[] getObjectiveCards()
      Retrieves the array of objective cards currently placed on the board.
      Returns:
      An array of ObjectiveCard objects representing the objective cards on the board.

    • getGoldCards

      public ArrayList<PlayableCard[]> getGoldCards()
      Retrieves the list of arrays of gold cards currently placed on the board. Each array contains front and back cards of gold type.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of PlayableCard arrays representing the gold cards on the board.

    • getResourceCards

      public ArrayList<PlayableCard[]> getResourceCards()
      Retrieves the list of arrays of resource cards currently placed on the board. Each array contains front and back cards of resource type.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of PlayableCard arrays representing the resource cards on the board.

    • getGoldCardsDeck

      public Deck getGoldCardsDeck()
      Retrieves the deck of gold cards used on the board.
      Returns:
      The Deck object representing the deck of gold cards.

    • getResourcesCardsDeck

      public Deck getResourcesCardsDeck()
      Retrieves the deck of resource cards used on the board.
      Returns:
      The Deck object representing the deck of resource cards.

    • takeObjectiveCard

      public ObjectiveCard takeObjectiveCard() throws DeckEmptyException
      Retrieves an objective card from the objective cards deck.
      Returns:
      An ObjectiveCard object picked from the objective cards deck.
      Throws:
      DeckEmptyException - If the objective cards deck is empty when trying to draw a card.

    • takeCardfromBoard

      public PlayableCard[] takeCardfromBoard(CardType cardType, boolean drawFromDeck, int pos) throws IllegalArgumentException, DeckEmptyException, IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Takes a card from the board. Depending on parameters, either draws a card from the respective deck or takes a card from the board.
      Parameters:
      cardType - The type of card to take (GoldCard or ResourceCard).
      drawFromDeck - True if the card should be drawn from the deck, false if taken from the board.
      pos - The position of the card to take if drawing from the board.
      Returns:
      The PlayableCard array representing the front and back cards taken from the board or deck.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If trying to draw an InitialCard, which is not allowed.
      DeckEmptyException - If the respective deck is empty when trying to draw a card.
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the position on the board is not valid.

    • updateArray

      public void updateArray(ArrayList<PlayableCard[]> cards, CardType cardType) throws DeckEmptyException
      Updates the array of cards on the board by drawing a new card from the respective deck.
      Parameters:
      cards - The ArrayList of PlayableCard arrays representing the cards on the board to update.
      cardType - The type of card (GoldCard or ResourceCard) for which to update the array.
      Throws:
      DeckEmptyException - If the respective deck is empty when trying to draw a card.

    • verifyGoldCardsNumber

      public boolean verifyGoldCardsNumber()
      Verify the number of Gold cards on the Board
      Returns:
      TRUE if there's a correct number of Gold Cards on the Board

    • verifyResourceCardsNumber

      public boolean verifyResourceCardsNumber()
      Verify the number of Resource cards on the Board
      Returns:
      TRUE if there's a correct number of Resource Cards on the Board

    • verifyObjectiveCardsNumber

      public boolean verifyObjectiveCardsNumber()
      Verify the number of Objective cards on the Board
      Returns:
      TRUE if there's a correct number of Objective Cards on the Board

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Generates a string representation of the board, including the current state of gold cards, resource cards, and objective cards on the board.
      Overrides:

      Returns:
      A string representation of the board.
